channel.title: Layouts :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Windows Presentation Foundation provides a number of container elements that fulfill the specialized purpose of layouts. Unlike most WPF controls, they can have multiple children, which they organize on-screen. And unlike Windows Forms, these layouts adjust to the available space. Let’s examine each of five layouts in turn: The Grid The default layout is the Grid, which lays out its children elements in a grid pattern. A <Grid> is composed of columns and rows, the number and characteristics of which are defined by the grid’s ColumnDefinitions and RowDefinitions properties.
